articles.content:
Letter and gift to Kim Jong Il from Sudanese President 
    Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a personal letter and a gift from Sudanese President Omar Hassan Ahmed al-Bashir.   The letter and gift were handed to Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun on May 3 by Sudanese Foreign Minister Mustafa Osman Ismail on a visit to Korea.

articles.content:
IFRC foundation anniversary marked
    Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The central committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society sponsored a film show on Monday to mark the 80th anniversary of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC).    Invited to it were head Sten Swedlund and members of a delegation of the IFRC which is staying in Korea for its assistance to the DPRK.    Choe Chun Hyon, vice-chairman of the c.c. Of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and other officials concerned were present.    The participants saw a film on the activities of the IFRC.

U.S. military strikes against Yugoslavia
articles.content:
Probe into "case of people's revolutionary party"  urged
   Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- A declaration of 1,000 people demanding a probe into the "case of the people's revolutionary party" was made public in Seoul recently, the South Korean newspaper Hangyore said.   The "case of the people's revolutionary party" was a plot faked up by military dictator Park Chung Hee to check the people's struggle for independence, democracy and reunification. 8 patriots were killed in April 1975 on charges of involvement in the "case."    The declaration urged the authorities to probe the truth behind the "case," contending that "the miserable history in which the innocent people were killed by torture and fabrication should no longer be buried in oblivion."

articles.title: Japan's undisguised ambition for overseas aggression
articles.content:
U.S. military strikes against Yugoslavia
    Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The United States is a heinous criminal who bred and orchestrated the tragic crisis in Yugoslavia, observes Rodong Sinmun in a commentary on Monday.
   The commentary continues:   Military strikes against Yugoslavia are part of the vicious and crafty moves of the United States to materialize its ambition for world supremacy.   
   Through the strikes the United States is intending to demonstrate its might as a "sole superpower" and further consolidate its control over Europe.
   Projecting itself as a "sole superpower" at the end of the Cold War, the United States  demanded all countries and nations around the world act under its baton. It needed  countries to fall prey to it in order to convince other countries that any countries defying its brigandish demands are bound to pay a "dear price".  Iraq and Yugoslavia  were chosen as its victims.   
   It is the U.S. strategy towards Europe to establish control over Europe taking hold of NATO.
   Hence, the United States has organized and spearheaded the current NATO's  military strikes against Yugoslavia.
   Military attack on Yugoslavia is also related to the political and economic crisis that has become worsened in the United States with each passing day.
   The United States is wholly to blame for the tragic situation in Yugoslavia.

KCTU representatives leave Pyongyang
   Pyongyang, May 4 (KCNA) -- The representatives of the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), Ri Kyu Jae, who is vice-president of the confederation and chairman of its unification committee, and Jo Jun Ho, who is member of the committee, left here today.   Ri Jin Su, vice-chairman of the c.c. of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and officials concerned saw them off at the airport.
